<p>In March of 2009, the U.S. redefined its strategy in Southeast Asia by combining the conflicts in Afghanistan and Pakistan into “one existential threat.”  Essentially, U.S. and NATO forces engaged in the region now deal with the insurgency in Afghanistan alongside the militancy in Pakistan.  </p>
<p>In tonight’s PRISM segment, we look at whether the AfPak strategy has proved to be more effective than looking at the countries separately. </p>
<p><strong>Hadley Gamble</strong>CNN Abu Dhabi</p>
